author: .paulharris
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/224 wondering what the advantage of pushing signature in the api is? i'm assuming theres a reason behind that which Im not across...
I mean I understand that its to allow us to determine which is the aggregator, I'm just wondering if the determination that you're an aggregator somehow isn't present under the distributed model, so it needs to be determined via the BN or something?

author: alon.ssv.network
content:
Under the emerging DVT spec the DVT node is connected to a remote signer and BN. It handles internally some VC functions (like isAggregator) so to not force BN changes, simplicity and overall easier development. Under that spec no need to change the Beacon API.
I'm guessing this is something Obol specific.

https://github.com/ethereum/distributed-validator-specs/tree/dev/src/dvspec#operation-of-distributed-validator-client-dvc
